DOC.brief_summary: This randomize controlled trial investigate effect general anesthesia versus conscious sedation operative time patient undergoing transcatheter aortic valve replacement .
DOC.brief_title: Conscious Sedation v General Anesthesia TAVR Patients
DOC.criteria: 1 . Signed informed consent , sign Health Insurance Portability Accountability Act ( HIPAA ) documentation ) 2 . Age 18 year age . 3 . Women child bear age must negative urine serum pregnancy test . 4 . Clinical indication transfemoral aortic valve replacement . 5 . English Spanish speaking 6 . No evidence neurological impairment define NIHSS ≤ 1 modify Rankin scale ( mRS ) ≤ 2 within 7 day prior randomization . 1 . BMI > 40 2 . Diagnosis severe obstructive sleep apnea base previous polysomnography , severe define apneahypopnea index ( AHI ) > 30 episodes/hr . 3 . High risk aspiration severe esophageal disease ( e.g . achalasia , gastroparesis , etc ) . 4 . Inability lie supine 30 minute . 5 . Marginal femoral vessel concern possible conversion transapical transaortic access . 6 . Patient refusal 7 . Patient involve another research study 8 . Psychiatric condition preclude ability provide inform consent 9 . History clinical stroke within 3 month prior randomization
